name: Renaissance Aruba Resort & Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: A very nice and large hotel in the centre of Oranjestad, near the Ferry Terminal. The hotel has its own private island with flamingo's which is absolutely perfect! There is a boat travelling from within the hotel to the island every 15 minutes or so.
reviews.title: Loved the private island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Staff was very friendly and the beds are very good. The view on the city was not very impressive as are the possiblities to party.
reviews.title: Great location, but needs some polish and updating

likes.liked: — Pool area, beach and cove, convenience, roomy suite room, tour operators and car rental in lobby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Renaissance Aruba for a week at Thanksgiving, 2006 - myself, my husband and our two children (ages 3 and 6 - who are avid travelers). The hotel is incredibly convenient, particularly for families or those looking to save by eating "off site" (read: cheap). Walk to fast food, local shops, the market....also an easy walk to see the boats/ships at the marina and enjoy the wonderful shops/restaurants in the main downtown area. We stayed at the beachfront suites - which was perfect for our family (kids slept on the pull out in the "living room"). Loved the fridge/microwave/counter space for fixing snacks and keeping drinks (like every resort, the bar drinks are ridculously expensive). The little cove out front is perfect for small children, and the private island is a nice treat (but very windy some days).
reviews.title: Long review, but essential!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The property is showing age, especially compared with the newer (but more crowded) resorts on the other Aruba beaches. The elevators are slow and crowded. There is no gift/necessities shop in the Beach portion (there is in the Marina portion). Bathrooms are small and dingy, but you don't go to Aruba for the view *inside*, I guess!
reviews.title: Solid Family Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In general, Aruba is a wonderful, safe vacation place - very welcoming to tourists and to children. Don't go and spend all your time at the hotel - get out and explore! Our kids loved the beach, the iguanas, snorkeling, the submarine trip, off-roading in a Jeep and playing at Baby Beach. La Petit Cafe is wonderful! Cab drivers are very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Ocean Suites, nice but old

likes.liked: — Location in the center of Oranjestad yet very quiet

reviews.title: Marina - if you like downtown
reviews.text: First of all, who we are: we live in France, I am Brazilian and my wife is French and we travel a lot for business and leisure. We like to enjoy the local culture but, when we go to the beach, we like to relax and not be bothered by tourist activities and other things some other people love. We went to Aruba for the first time last January and decided to stay at the Renaissance based on the hotel brand and on the nice pictures we saw in the Internet. Overall, the experience was OK but next time we will stay at the low-rises at Eagle beach.

reviews.title: Renaissance Aruba Resort & Casino Marina
reviews.text: - SERVICE: The maids are lovely! They are very nice, simple and helpful, always answering with a sincere smile. The front-desk though is another story: rude, not knowledgeable and arrogant. We arrived at 4:30pm after a long flight from Boston via Puerto Rico and, for our surprise (sort of), our room was not ready because "a VIP decided to check-out late". We were offered to change our clothes at the Spa but we could not take our bags there. After they figured we were extremely upset, they decided to let us carry our bags to the Spa. The Hotel Manager also gave us a lot of gifts to try to smooth things out. We had almost forgotten the incident when, checking-out 7 days later at 11:57am, we were "friendly reminded" that we were supposed to leave before noon! Simply ridiculous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - LOCATION: If you cannot live far from agglomerations, traffic and the usual tourist traps, then the Renaissance is for you. If you are looking for typical high-rises with five swimming pools, lots of teenagers, and US food chains, go north. If you are looking for a more relaxing and refined "European" experience, you should stay at the low rises. The Marina is very noisy; if you stay at one of the rooms in the atrium of overlooking the swimming pool, chances are you are not going to get much sleep (but that might not be a problem for you!). Rooms facing the city are quieter but still you can have problems to fall asleep if you are very sensitive to outside noise. The lounge right across the street closes at 5am and it can be very loud sometimes.
reviews.title: Marina Hotel
Renaissance Ocean Suites
reviews.text: - ROOMS: We had an Island King. Coming from Europe, they don't seem small, with exception of the bathroom that could be a bit larger. The beds are very comfortable and the balcony was nice. Not a Four Seasons but very coherent with the price and with the Marriot brand. If you are looking for your typical American room with 100 sqm. and a huge bath tub, go somewhere else.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - RESTAURANTS: Everything is very pricey ($30-45 per person) unless you don't care eating typical food at the small places behind the bus station (awesome!). We ate at the famous Driftwood and it was worth every penny! But watch-out, if you cannot eat garlic, Aruba is not a place for you to enjoy the local cuisine. We also ate at the Aquarium (courtesy of the Manager) and it was very good. The seafood buffet and breakfast are delicious and worth the price. We also tried the Marketplace but, unless you are looking for fast food, it is not worth the effort (the live music is excellent though). Everywhere you go drinks are simply ridiculous mixes of water and some sort of artificial fruit flavor; far from the fruit punches one can get in Brazil. The local beer is good though. We bought our food at the big grocery store outside downtown and ate very healthy every day.
reviews.title: Just the Facts…

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is well established, and is in a great location. We were in the Ocean Suites in room 2216. We were facing the parking lot. The best I can figure, about 25% of the rooms face the parking lot, and the rest have a nice view of Ocean or pools or both. The room was nice and roomy. The hallways had a little smell, and the stairways had a major smell. The lobby was nice, pool area was very nice. The best thing about the location is the short boat ride to the private island. Very cool island, very relaxing, not as windy, water was calm. Family friendly on left side (Iguana Beach)...Adults Only on right side (Flamingo Beach). A few ladies were topless each day we visited, but discreetly so (not running or walking around).
reviews.title: Great location, Okay hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a movie theater right next door, lots of restaurants within walking distance. So the location can't be beat.
reviews.title: Adult Exclusive Renaissance Marina Hotel is the way to go!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although this is now a Marriott location, and it is called the Renaissance, I don't think it is part of the Marriott Renaissance upper-line of hotels. It can't be. It was very average. I'm guessing it had the name "Renaissance" before Marriott bought them recently.
reviews.title: The pros and cons

likes.liked: — Convenient to walk to Restaurants and shopping.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: All in all, a great week's vacation. We would probably go back to Puerto Vallarta or Cabo instead, but still enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Ocean Suites are Paradise

likes.liked: — Size of the room 1 king bed, queen pull-out couch and requested rollaway and still had plenty of room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just got back from a long weekend stay at the Renaissance Marina Hotel - we loved the fact that this part of the hotel is adult-exclusive. The pool, martini bar, casino and private adult only section on Renaissance Island were perfect for us.
reviews.title: Great Vacation

likes.liked: — location, boat ride to private island and private island, pool
likes.disliked: — some problems at check-in, some bugs in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a place to stay that is right in the middle of everything and is still able to give you piece of mind this is the place to be. We stayed in the Ocean View Suites, by far better of the two. The rooms are bigger, you have your own mini bar as well as an more than adequate bathroom. Our room faced the parking lot but that was ok, because the ocean view room smelled of chlorine. This hotel has 2 pools ( which one has the swim up bar), man made beach which is just gorgeous, the water comes from right out of the ocean The hotel staff was great. The front desk is able to change over U.S. currency for Arubia's "Florian" currency if you want. Everyone takes U.S. currency. The housekeeping staff is the best. They come by your twice a day, once to clean your room and second just to make sure if you need anything extra not to mention to give you nice chocolates and a little card to tell what the weather will be the next day. I can even begin to tell you about how beautiful the Renaissance private island is. This island is exclusive for Renaissance patrons only!!!! If you are looking for a great hotel where you don't have to rent a car, you can just walk to everything, lay on the beach or just hang out by the pool or go to a private island as many times as you want.....this is the perfect place to be.
reviews.title: Loved the Renaissance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Renaissance over Memorial Day weekend. It was our first trip to Aruba. Just for perspective, we're in our early 30's - newlyweds. We've vacationed in other tropical islands in the Carribean (Bahamas, Haiti, St. Thomas and Puerto rico) and French Polynesia (Tahiti and Bora Bora). We were not impressed by this hotel.
reviews.title: Regret staying here

likes.liked: — private island/ discount booklet / close to a really good dunkin donuts
likes.disliked: — dirty rooms, small pool, mildew smell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First - comments on the hotel:
reviews.title: Do not Believe the Brochure or the other positive comments! Buyer Beware!!

likes.disliked: — All outdated property (lobby, rooms...etc.), island near airport very noisy location not in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is right in the middle of downtown...first hotel on the strip. Upon check in there was a moldy smell at the front desk even though the front desk is outside by the pool with plenty of ventilation. Check in was fast - we reserved a king room on the highest floor (6) with courtyard view. The room was tiny and it felt humid even though the air conditioning was on. It didn't smell as bad as the front desk but it didn't have a clean feeling either. Walking down the hall it looked and felt more like a Best Western or Days Inn, instead of a category 5 Marriott. Yes the bathrooms are small, but not so bad. It felt more like we were in a cabin on a cruiseship instead of a resort in Aruba but I know it was b/c we reserved a courtyard view - we had a view of the hallway and lobby. I think this hotel needs some major renovations. It wasn't as noisy as other reviews said - i think it was b/c we were on the highest floor. The worst part of the room was I started noticing little red bumps on my arms and ankles. They got really itchy and they swoll up to big red bumps. I thought it was just mosquitos but then my husband was getting bitten too. So we lifted the sheets and found a few tiny bugs with wings on them!! It was really gross. I slept on towels the rest of the trip. Bottom line....our room felt dirty, damp and just not fresh like a typical marriott room in the US. I am not a picky vacationer...I know sometimes quality is not as good as the states when you travel outside the US unless you pay a lot of money but this really was not worth the money. I honestly felt it ruined our stay in Aruba. I was torn b/t the Renaissance and Stellaris and I wish we stayed at the Stellaris. The hotel is so much nicer and seems newer. At first I thought the Renaissance would be better b/c of the private island, but the beach at the Stellaris was sooo much nicer and bigger. The pool was huge and gorgeous and it just seemed to be a nicer, more luxurious hotel. It's like comparing a holiday inn to a W hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location...Close to everything...

likes.disliked: — Rooms could have been a little bigger. Was just fine though.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007
reviews.text: The Okeanos spa - The spa is located right in the fitness center. I visit spas at least once a month for massages. This was a no frills spa. It's very small. The only extra it had was a dry sauna. They also have showers and a lounge but that's about it. I got a hot stone massage and my husband got a deep tissue and they were awesome. The spa was not fancy, but the massages made up for it. Definitely one of the best I've had! Also, you get 10% off if you stay at the hotel, which is a great deal. I would definitely recommend the services.
reviews.title: Next time we will stay on the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006
reviews.text: Okay...So my fiance and I went to Aruba for a 4-day weekend to consider options for our island wedding. Our travel agent suggested this hotel, as she felt it would be the best for a large group. She boasted about the beautiful private island where most weddings take place. I had been looking at reviews of this hotel for a week or two prior to our trip and continue to look since we left in November. I am completely baffled as to why no one is mentioning the fact that the private island is directly in front of the airport!!!?? The island is beautiful, but it is ruined by the earth shattering noise of jet engines taking off behind you. I'm talking trees shaking, birds flying out of the trees, can't hear yourself think loud - EVERY 15 minutes or so! I can not figure out why no one is mentioning this so I HAD TO add my 2 cents. Besides, there was trash floating in the water of the private island (and in the water out front of the Ocean Suites beach as well). For whatever reason, they have their beach water blocked off from the rest of the ocean with rocks, so that it's like a pool or a pond. We rented a jeep to check out a bunch of hotels and found that the beaches by the Bucuti and the Occidental were much more beautiful and authentically tropical. The Renaissance beaches appear man-made and "fake" compared to the others. On a positive note, the location is great if you like to be in the middle of it all. Great food - great bars. Standard rooms in the marina were small and the bathrooms were small and outdated. We were given a tour of the best rooms in the Marina and in the Ocean Suites. They have some awesome luxury suites in both properties, however, the higher end Ocean Suites were amazing. I could say so much more, but I really just wanted to put it out there about the airplane noise at the island. Needless to say, we opted not to get married there.
reviews.title: Private island next to airport
What an amazing island, had a great vacation
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Renaissance Marina hotel for a week before Christmas. I was very pleased with the hotel and accomodations. My boyfriend proposed to me while down there and worked extensively with the Marriott Platinum concierge to arrange a private waterfront dinner. The level of service provided was exceptional. The conceirge was always willing to set up reservations and any excursions we were interested in. The biggest plus of the hotel was the private island. A ferry boat comes right into the hotel and within 10 min you are in paradise. White sand beaches complete with flamingos, iguana, hammocks and amazing sunsets. The beach was never overly crowded like some of the high rise hotel beaches. The rooms at the hotel were nice, ask for an upgrade to the top floor, the high ceilings make the mid-sized rooms seem larger. The bathrooms are a bit small and we had some issues with the hot water control. The hotel is very clean and the martini bar blue is great. Be sure to check out happy hour from 4:30-6:30 (i think), 2 for 1 drinks, good deal. The hotel is also mostly for couples, although there were a few kids it was very relaxing. The Ocean Suites, their sister hotel across the street, had a great pool and beach on a lagoon and was more family friendly. The food at the hotel was good, try the lunch buffet or the tapas for a snack at the pool. The hotel is also very close to tons of shops, they start in the hotel lobby and extend all the way down the street, everything from souvenier shops to Gucci and Guess.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006
reviews.text: As for restaurants, Madame Jeanettes is a must, one of the best meals I've ever eaten. Very romantic atmosphere complete with soloist during dinner. Flying Fishbone is great, we went for lunch and it was delicious. We also tried El Gaucho and Amazonia, both excellent steakhouses.
reviews.title: It was ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Rent a jeep wrangler for a day and tour the island. The north side of the island is gorgeous but most of the streets are dirt roads and some are VERY bumpy. The italian restaurant at the California lighthouse has great views, however the bar area gets hot and buggy.
reviews.title: Not bad at all!

likes.liked: — The private island, many options for shopping and eating, spa
likes.disliked: — Front-desk staff - too rude, too many times

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: Everyone on the island is extremely friendly, however bring some bug spray since there are a lot of flies everywhere.
reviews.title: Good Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi everyone!
reviews.title: A Very Objective Review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd like to give a very objective review on this resort and this island as a whole. I also wanted to inform you that I have been to other parts of the Caribbean so this may affect my opinions on this resort.
reviews.title: Wonderful 20th anniversary trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Description:
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay
Renaissance Marina-- Perfect hotel for adults
reviews.text: As you may know, there are 2 distinct locations for the Renaissance. They are called Renaissance Ocean Suites and Renaissance Mariana. In reading these reviews, I've always been confused of the pictures posted as some may or may not be related to the resort. Thus, the pictures attached are via the Renaissance resort ONLY.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Renaissance Ocean Suites: Please see first 3 pictures
reviews.title: Not Bad but Not Good

likes.disliked: — The room was not well cleaned on a daily basis. Nothing cleaned on a daily basis.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Renaissance Aruba. The best part about this hotel is definitely the private island. It was never too crowded, the lagoon was great for swimming, and with beverage service, it can't be beat! I was originally worried about the proximity to the airport, however being so relaxed, the periodic sound of the planes never bothered me. We also really really liked having the LG Steakhouse at the hotel. We went there twice and it was so delicious both times!! I would also highly recommend the 2-for-1 drink happy hour at the bar. The show, which we got free tickets for, was actually pretty entertaining!
reviews.title: Beautiful private island!

likes.liked: — Private island, LG steakhouse, view from room, happy hour
likes.disliked: — Rude casino staff, pay movies didn't work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did encounter two issues. One was that our pay movie channels was not accessible one evening. The other was that our $20 casino credit didn't work when we tried to use it. They told us that we had already used it at the casino across the street at 2am the previous evening - totally false as we had stayed in the entire evening! When we told them such, they basically called us liars until we told them to check the security cameras. Finally they agreed to give us back the credit. Since the casino credit was linked to our room key, I was worried that someone had access to our room! Definitely a scary thought. Thank goodness for the in-room safe!
reviews.title: Two cents on Renaissance Aruba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Outside of these encounters, we had a wonderful time during our stay at the Renaissance and would not mind staying here again in the future. We felt that the private island alone is worth it.
reviews.title: Good Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007
reviews.text: Ok experience. The private island was pretty cool; my only complaint is that the bar should have been on the adults only beach on the island (there is a family friendly beach as well). Also, the private island is in the flight path for the airport. There are two hotels for this property, the Marina (adults only) and the Ocean Suites (family friendly). However, the hotel staff does not enforce the adults only at the Marina hotel, at least at the Marina pool anyway. Rooms kinda small; this property is in the capital city of Oranjestad, many great restaurants nearby. Also, a short taxi ride ($10) will get you up to Palm Beach where all the other resorts are located.
reviews.title: Just OK for a Renaissance Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007
reviews.text: First time in Aruba and had a very enjoyable experience. The Hotel was in the best part of Aruba. We took a jeep tour of the Island and after seeing some of the more rundown areas, we felt even better with our hotel selection. The pool on the second floor level overlooked the marina and the cruise ships (at least 4 docked and departed during our week long stay). The private island was great, very relaxing and clean. At night you could walk a couple of blocks and find small restaurants and pubs and the casino was open 24 hours. Over all the poverty in Aruba surprised me but if you stay in the resort areas it was pretty good. Plenty of sunshine and the water was great.
reviews.title: Great hotel...but skip the spa!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Renaissance Aruba to celebrate our honeymoon, we get married on May 5th. (we found this Hotel in this precise site). Well, maybe because we have being in Cancun a few times (around 10 each), we compare this Hotel with the ones we have being and there is no room to compare. The hotel is old, the carpets look dirt, the Air Conditioner is not clean as well. We spend a fortune in the Hotel, over $2,000 USD, (for 4 nights) and we think that the correct amount most be, for the relation price-product, about a third part of it. In resume, do not go there. The only thing that is worth it is the private beach, but the food in there is lousy and you have no other options, besides you are not allowed to bring your own. Aruba people are kind, the ones form the hotel not really, but the ones who work at the stores, the taxi drivers, are, and they speak at least 4 languages, English, Dutch, Spanish and Papiamento (local dialect), but the place is not precisely the paradise we were looking for, actually we had it pretty near our home, but you know, the honeymooners look extravagant places to go.
reviews.title: Sincerely,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is my second time at this resort in Aruba in last two years. The hotel is located in the town and has two building. The main building is located next to the marina and to the shopping malls and mostly oriented toward adult clientele. The hotel has pool and no beach. The second building is located accross main strreet in the town on other side of the road and marina and mainly oriented toward families. It has nice big pools with the pool bars and very small beach. The person traveling to Aruba might get surprised - hotels in Aruba without beach? This will be very incorect statement. This hotel has most beatiful beach in Aruba. Being in Aruba more than few time (my favorite island in Carribean) and being on every resort and public beach on the island, I can say that this hotel has one of the best beaches on island and it is private and open to hotel guests only. You will need to take a 10 minutes boat ride from any of the buildings to get to the private island protected from ocean waves. There are 2 beaches on island - Iguana beach with iguanas and flamingo beach with live flamingos. There are parrots and other birds as well as restourants and sport facilities.
reviews.title: Second Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms in both hotels are of a decent size anad clean. Do not buy all inclusive package because there are large number of restaurants of very good quality around both buildings.
reviews.title: Aruba Renaissance Marina Hotel

likes.disliked: — probably the pool but we didn't want to use it because we had the island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Between building is a free golf cart type transportation.
reviews.title: Great location for a 1st visit to Aruba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Having read other reviews on trip advisor we were a bit concerned about this hotel however we found the entire trip to be a delight. This was our first trip to Aruba, April 28 - May 5. Aruba offers everything that we love; sun, sand, beach, great drinking water, shopping, great food, nice people and casino nightlife.
reviews.title: wonderful vacation

description: The wonder of Renaissance Aruba isn’t just white sandy beaches, or crystal blue waters. The chance to discover something wonderful is all over the island, and we can show you the way. Our location in Oranjestad’s vibrant downtown gives you endless opportunities to indulge your inner shopaholic, get the thrill of a hand of poker in our two casinos, or take in Aruban culture from the beating heart of Aruba’s capital city. For an escape within an escape take a water taxi to Renaissance Island, Aruba’s only private beaches. Its pristine, secluded shores offer peace and solitude simply not found anywhere else in the world.We offer two hotels each with their own unique experience, but still allow you to enjoy the amenities of both. The Renaissance Marina Hotel was especially designed to be an intimate couples escape, and features a water launch to Renaissance Island from inside the hotel itself. Renaissance Ocean Suites is perfect for families so the littlest ones can discover the wonders of paradise for themselves. No matter where you go with Renaissance Aruba Resort and Casino we will be your guide to finding everything this happy island has to offer.
